title: Logarithmically concave measure
summary: In mathematics, a Borel measure μ on n-dimensional Euclidean space R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} is called logarithmically concave (or log-concave for short) if, for any compact subsets A and B of R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} and 0 < λ < 1, one has
